page.title: 11ST JOHN THE BAPTIST CHURCH
page.content: St John the Baptist Church is a large red brick building and in 1985 it celebrates its centenary.Our school is the only primary school attached to the Church of England in Leicester.On May 20th 1884 the foundation stone was laid.Money for the church was given by Miss Barlow and in 1885 an eminent congregation came to the opening service on September 17th.They came by steam train,tram,coach and horses or walked.Today people go to church by car,bus or walk.It has a small churchyard and is surrounded by a mixture of large Victorian and newer houses.The windows are stone arches in opaque glass with coloured ones near the altar.Wooden pews,on a wood block floor,hold 10 people.Inside the tall walls are of yellow grey brick with a strong,wooden roof.The inside is dark.
